description.narrative: The project has three main components: (i) a medium-sized hydropower plant of 140 megawatts (MW) with significant water storage facilities and associated transmission lines to evacuate the generated power; (ii) rural electrification and community development in the project area, and (iii) a reform and restructuring plan for the national utility, the Nepal Electricity Authority (NEA). The project site is in the Seti River in the Tanahu district, about 150 kilometers (km) west of Kathmandu.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Increased efficiency and supply of reliable hydropower energy

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
Winter's power shortage alleviated by 2024 (from the load shedding of 14-18 hours a day in 2011 to less than 10 hours in 2024)

description.narrative: Increased efficiency and supply of reliable hydropower energy

title.narrative: Increase in hydropower capacity available year-round to 246 MW in 2024 (2012 baseline: 92 MW)

description.narrative: Increased efficiency and supply of reliable hydropower energy

title.narrative: Increase in additional electricity generation of 588 GWh/year from the Tanahu hydropower plant in 2024

description.narrative: Increased efficiency and supply of reliable hydropower energy
